Reviews.Title: “Not such a bad choice at all in tricky Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Lucie81
Reviews.Content: This place is not a bad choice at all. It will provide you all you need - clean bed with nice sheets, simple furnishing and decent breakfast. I booked it just to be on safe side, to have some place reserved while I intended to continue searching for some nice yet affordable place on grachtengordel or Centraal area to show it to my friend who was travelling with me. Unfortunatelly and stupidly, I clicked on nonrefundable rate when booking via booking.com and though Booking was indeed very hard trying to convince the hotel to change for refundable rate, the hotel denied. It did not sound very guest-friendly to me so I was awaiting anything but nice stay since the reviews varied from satisfied to disgusted but in the end, it was not bad at all. It is outside of the center but it is well reachable by several tram and bus lines and in interesting, nice and safe surroundings of Rivierenbuurt (no De Pijp as the hotel claims on its website though). It is within good reach of Museumplein as well. The heating heated more than well and you could stop or switch it on as and wenever you wanted. Sheets were clean and towels were changed. The furnishing is modern, very simple and basic and due to the year of refurnishing slightly worn out but not too bad. There was a hairdryer in the bathroom and seemed to be pretty efficient even for long hair. There was also safe box but seemed not to be working. The shower might be weird for the rest of the Europe but fine for Dutch standards - it lacks the basin and the glass walls, you simple take the shower standing on the floor in between the concrete walls behind the courtain). Probably also thanks to this fact the bathroom has a bit wetty smell but nothing serious - some odorizer would cure this quickly). What I hated was the strong cigarette smell in the room although I in the order clearly insisted on non smoking but really non smoking room. Well, the room had the sign banning the smoking in the room AND it had the old tobacco odour as well. I more and more think that this is rather problem of us, guests. Many people request non smoking rooms then smoke in them and the hotels in busy locations simply do not have chance to get rid of the smell in between. There is also very poor isolations between the staircase and the rooms, you hear everybody climbing up and down the typical Dutch (narrow and steep) staircase, laughs and also even water dropping into the bathtub in the room above of the ours (we had 203) so bring your ear plug-ins along. The breakfast is included in room price and is served in the pleasant breakfast area with a range of products including bread, knackebrot, corn flakes, croissants, ham, cheese, salami, very good white yoghurt, hageslag, cocoa, coffee, tea and box juice for free, while it was also possible to ask for some additional treats such as scrambled eggs, toasts, basic fruits such as bananas and apples, fresh juice and espresso against payment. There is little supermarket just next door, and there are several other shops including another grocery, chemists, tobacco, flower shop and several restaurants by the tram stop on the square. I strongly recommend you to try out the Thai Indonesian place by the tram stop Viktorieplein. We went there, had degustation menu of maybe 25 courses and the meal as well as the stuff was lovely. The old guy was as nice, friendly and wise as the old shaman on Eat, Pray, Love. We had really nice evening there.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay: clean and well located”
Reviews.Author: katyandmark_1710
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Victorie in early September 2011. We had a clean room, with ensuite bathroom and a balcony. This hotel, like many in Amsterdam, was in a tall building with a winding, narrow spiral staircase and no lift - this was fine for us but may not be for others. It is a little way out from central Amsterdam, but is situated on the number 4 tram route so it was very easy to get into the city centre. It also very close to the RAI station, and from here it does not take long to get to Schipol by train. The breakfast was included in the rates and it was fine: the usual cereal, fruit, cheese and cold meat, coffee, tea, juice etc. There were no coffee/tea making facilities in the room but we asked for a cup of tea in the afternoon and reception made it for us. The staff were friendly and helpful. The room rates were subject to change: originally we booked for 3 nights and paid 99 Euros per night for the room (incl breakfast), which is good value for Amsterdam. However, we wanted to stay an additional night and the price for the room went up to 190 Euros, which was a massive increase. This was because there was a conference at the nearby RAI centre. So it is hard to say whether this place is good value or not - as their rates can change.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: sara m
Reviews.Content: We had a nightmare finding the hotel so if your flying to Schipol, go to the train station and catch the train to RAI Station (~3 euros each, platform 3?). Outside the RAI station catch the no:4 tram towards Centraal and get off at Victoriaplein. Cross the road and turn right, then right again and the hotel is about 50m in front of you. Positives: +Fabulous breakfast, a great range of cheeses and meats, breads, tea and coffee and juice. +Nice room for a short stay. +Modern looking and well decorated +Staff spoke very good English Negatives: -No lift and we were on the 4th floor! Taking 2 suitcases up 4 flights of very narrow and circular stairs is a nightmare! -Although the room was very modern and clean the only thing that was cleaned daily was the towels. Would have liked the sheets changed and the floors hoovered as they gathered a lot of dust and hair. -The room had no air con and was boiling but thankfully they had put a fan in, which was very useful. - not tea and coffee facilities in the room :( Although the hotel seems far away from town its a very short tram ride to the centre on tram no:4. Trams stop at 12:30 so if your going to stay out you can catch the 354 night bus from centraal or Leidseplein and get off at victoriaplein for the hotel. We got a 4day tram ticket on the first day from the tram centre at centraal and you can use them on both trams and night buses, which works out much cheaper. You can also catch the no:12 tram from Walstraat which will go to museumplein for van gogh and other museums. The thing I was most disappointed at however was that a few days before we arrived our room was reduced by Â£40 and this wasn't refunded to us and we couldn't cancel the booking either :(

Reviews.Title: “This place is a rip off...”
Reviews.Author: kvc32
Reviews.Content: I originally booked a room for three nights. When I checked in I told them I was only going to stay for two nights and paid up front for two nights. When I checked out they insisted I pay for the third night which I refused to do but they went and charged my cc on file for the extra night. Also there was no lift to get luggage up or down to upper floors. Wet towels were not changed and the location is far from the cemter of the city and was very noisy. I do not recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Very small, but clean and friendly with good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: KarenFaulkner
Reviews.Content: I arrived on a Saturday afternoon, payed quickly and had my suitcase carried to my room. My room was very small (bed touching 3 out of 4 walls), but it had a TV with English channels, large clean towels, the room was clean and the shower was great (very powerful and hot). The room was cleaned without fail every day, and my towels were changed when I left them on the floor as instructed. The room had a small balcony which looked out onto other apartments (unfortunately there were cigarette butts in the plant pots). Breakfast was served 7.30 - 10 and was cereals, meats, cheeses, pastries, bread rolls, jams and hard boiled eggs. Extras available when paid for. It was quite a way from the centre of the city but the public transport is excellent (15 mins by tram which ran every 10 mins), and wasn't far from the airport. Quiet at night with blackout blinds. All in all a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the price”
Reviews.Author: apache85
Reviews.Content: I stayed 4 nights at Hotel Victorie, and overall the experience was positive. The staff were very friendly and helpful, the room was quiet and comfortable, and the breakfast included in the room price was decent. The hotel could improve immensely by focusing on the little things like replacing worn out furniture in rooms (I was too scared to use the desk in mine, it was extremely wobbly and about ready to collapse) and maybe adding some extra lighting and ceramic tiles to the bathroom and shower recess. It was quite dimly lit in there, and I scratched myself on the cement wall several times. Those points aside, Victorie Hotel doesn't hold itself out to be a luxury hotel. For someone who wants to keep costs reasonable (difficult in Amsterdam) and stay in a decent hotel, Victorie Hotel would do just fine.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: San Antonio De Belen, Costa Rica
Reviews.Title: “Better not to use the staircase with some drinks!”
Reviews.Author: al_batalla
Reviews.Content: The rooms seem recently remodel, our king size bed was too floofy for our taste and the shower floor kind of rough (like brush concrete), a pitty that ceramic tile was not installed (a recommendation). The service and cleanliness was very good as well as the breakfast! The Wi-fi was erratic, make sure to call front desk and ask to re-boot the router, insist! Overall a good value for money option in AMS!

Reviews.Title: “You can stay closer to civilisation in a better hotel for less”
Reviews.Author: livirem
Reviews.Content: As I said you can be a lot closer to things for the same or less money and if you are going to stay here I would strongly recommend getting a GVB chipkaart ( http://www.gvb.nl/english/travellers/tickets-and-fares/Pages/GVB-24-48-72-96-hour-tickets.aspx ) if you donâ€™t you will spend a fortune on trams getting to here and back again as there is nothing to do in the surrounding area. The hotel is not hard to find once you get past wondering if you have strayed into a residential area. The service we received was friendly and the staff seemed to be pretty eager to please although we did not spend a much time other than sleeping and having breakfast in the hotel. On the subject of breakfast I would recommend spending the little extra and get it included as the quality was OK (Not great and we were there around 8am each day which is approx 30 minâ€™s after it started) but by Amsterdam standards good value for money. We paid extra for a king size bed, this was unbelievably soft but the sheets did seem to be clean. The room was in the front of the building and overlooked the road / tramlines but with the windows closed and the shutter down the noise intrusion from outside was minimal when we were trying to sleep. The room seemed to be clean but looking around the items in it and the dÃ©cor were very tired, every piece of furniture in the room looks like it has seen a lot of wear and the fan in the room was broken but in the main it was OK for somewhere to put your head down for a day or two. Unfortunately the bathroom was the one place that really let the hotel down, this area was not cleaned very well at all and the shower was covered in other peopleâ€™s hair, which also appeared to be blocking the shower drain and resulted in us standing in an inch of water in the bathroom. All in it was not an awful place to stay but if we do go back to Amsterdam we wonâ€™t be staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky Hotel with Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Pxlgrl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is quirky, but really good value for the price. The Good. Extremely close to the tram (2 minutes walk to two different tram lines). This made it easy to get to the city center and lots of attractions. The beds were comfy, everything was clean. Cute touches like candies on pillows. Staff was helpful and friendly. The European Continental breakfast was Great and featured fresh fruit and lots of good stuff to start your day like breads, pastries, hard boiled eggs, cheese and cold cuts. Free high speed internet right in the room. The Less Good The room was a bit hot, but included a great big fan which was helpful. Some things in the room didn't work, one of the lights for example. There is no lift and the stairs are steep and twisty. Be prepared for this! Despite its quirky and interesting design, you can see that the hotel is a little bit run down. Theres not a ton of stuff in the immediate vicinity so if you want to be in the center of it all - this isn't it. Overall This made a great base from which to explore Amsterdam. Loved the quiet location, easy to get to from the airport by train and tram. Easy to get to shopping and sight seeing. Breakfast was excellent, would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good and clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: kartoch
Reviews.Content: It's the first time we stayed at Amsterdam, and this hotel was quite correct. Clean, simple, breakfast is included and good. It is a bit far from the center of Asmterdam (20 minutes of tram) and price could been see as expensive (100â‚¬ / night for a room with two people), but we didn't find lower price in Amsterdam for hotel (Amsterdam is pretty but expensive city).

Reviews.Title: “Nice all round package of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: offthehinge
Reviews.Content: Went to Amsterdam with 4 other friends to have a laugh, bum around and soak the whole place up for a few days. We spent ages online trying to find a decent enough hotel that would have on suite bathrooms, double beds and if possible a breakfast thrown in with the price. Loads of places had shared bathrooms for the price we wanted to spend, which wasn't very appealing for the friends who were going as couples. We found Hotel Victorie, and all though a lot of pondering took place over if was too far out or not from the city centre we decided to give it a go because it was just in our budget range and had loads of good extras. This it seems to be a great decision as the place was only 10-15 from the main centre via the tram, and it being in a quiet neighbourhood, it was nice and peaceful. I cherish sleep when i get it, so happy days when hell isn't breaking loose outside your hotel window. The staff were very helpful and did a great job hosting us during our stay. A great recommendation for an Indonesian restaurant called Kantjil btw, cheers for that! My single room was a little pokey but had a nice balcony to chill on made up for the fact. The double rooms were nicely decorated and all slept well within them. The only gripe was that the walls are a little thin so it's not great if there are noisy guests staying in the hotel with you. Breakfast was simple but a great continental style selection of various bits. Free internet was a great added bonus. We stocked up on alcohol at a cheap supermarket, which was virtually next door (bars in the city sell drinks for over 5 euros, pretty expensive). Overall i'd recommend this to anyone except epic socialites who want to be in the thick of it in the centre of the night life getting wasted, who don't care about the fancy extras. Thanks Victorie for helping to make it a great holiday!

Reviews.Title: “Too far out for us!”
Reviews.Author: LondonYoungCouple
Reviews.Content: Having read the reviews on trip advisor prior to going we expected this hotel to be a little off the beaten track, but on arriving at the central station we were shocked at a taxi expecting 25 euros to take us to this hotel. It must be a 15 minute tramride and there seemed little to do in the surrounding area (no sign of any bars/nice restaurants) the surroundings resembled a London council estate. The hall and reception looked very well maintained and the woman on reception was very helpful, the place did have an air of being rather empty about it though, reception fire was unlit and there was no music playing. In the end we told her that we did not want to stay there due to the location, thankfully she called the sister hotel V Frederick . . . who we were glad to discover had one double left, and we stayed there instead. . .that was more like 10 mins to town centre.

Reviews.Title: “great deal for the price...”
Reviews.Author: kcemail2001
Reviews.Content: free wireless internet and free breakfast make this hotel a steal. if you need to stay right downtown, this is NOT the place for you. instead, this hotel is a little out of the fray, but in my opinion, in a perfect place. an easy 10 minute tram ride and/ or bike ride to anywhere. close to they albert cuyp market. i recommend booking this place and renting a bike. you will find no better deal. the staff was incredibly helpful, and the place feels more like a b&b than a hotel. lots of places to eat and find groceries in the neighborhood. a chocolate shop and "coffeeshop" within a block!

Reviews.Title: “Interesting but acceptable”
Reviews.Author: Desi_traveler_77
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Hotel V in amsterdam during our 14 day europe backpacking tour. First i have to say it is the most expensive hotel we have stayed at during the entire trip (124 euro). I did not realize how expensive hotels in amsterdam are if you don't want to stay in a hostel (hostels in amsterdam are a little shady if your not single and wasted.) Anyway, the hotel itself is located just outside of city center, not neccessarily a bad thing. There is a tram stop just at the corner so it is ver accesable, i believe Tram #4. More importantly when you are not completely with it after midnight the night bus is #355. The entrance to the hotel is a flight of steps that leads you to the lobby with a nice reception area. I guess the lobby person thought we were fit so she stuck us on the 4th floor. Typical amsterdam style, steep stairs that curve around. The room itself was pretty nice. The decor is very 70's with large cushions and weird looking furniture that has no purpose. The bed i have to say sucked. It was two twin beds pushed together, with wheels on a hardwood floor. Needless to say if you are with your significant other, over time there will be a big hole between two beds perfect to fall into. It was quite annoying. The bathroom was nice with a decent shower and good water pressure. The absolute best thing about the hotel is that it is quiet. In addition they provide a fan which is also nice. Overall its a decent hotel. The price is very elevated, but it is at par with most of the other hotels in amsterdam. The distance from the city center is not really as bad as some have made it, i believe its actually better in a way if you are looking for a quite place to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Funky and friendly”
Reviews.Author: Indianophile
Reviews.Content: My friends and I go to Amsterdam every year in the spring, and have stayed at a different hotel every time. Hotel V was the best by far. Reservations were handled efficiently, and everyone at the hotel was very helpful. The double rooms are well worth the extra money as the singles aren't half as funky. The location is not central, though it is very easy getting there from the airport. The nightime access is the one problem, I think a hotel either has to have someone up all night to let you in, or give you a key. Having to wake someone - however buff - in their underwear is a bit weird!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Dutch Service and Style”
Reviews.Author: calenton
Reviews.Content: Finally, last month we made our long expected trip to Amsterdam. From the numerous hotels that we checked on the web, Hotel V promised to be cool and central located (but without the noise of a busy street), exactly what we where looking for, so we decided to book this hotel. And it turned out to be the perfect decision. Everything was perfect, the rooms where clean and cool designed, they looked and felt like brand new, the breakfast was excellent with lots of different types of bread, good strong coffee and of course delicious Dutch cheese. At the reception there was 24 hrs. connection to internet (eMac notebook), but the most valuable of all, was the excellent service given by the different people working at Hotel V. Everyone, without exception, was very friendly, helpful and nice, we really felt there at home. All our questions were answered and we got lots of tips where to eat (where not to eat!), pubs, places to visit etc. Our stay in Amsterdam met all our expectations, and Hotel V and the people working there where part of this successful trip. Thank Tom for everything. Good luck! Paola & Marcelo

Reviews.Title: “loved the V”
Reviews.Author: organicphotographer
Reviews.Content: i've been to 20+ countries and i think the hotel V is my favorite in the world. i flew to europe via amsterdam and stayed the night arrived and then 4 nights to end my trip. i was looking forward to coming back the entire time i traveled. i am a professional artist and love interior design, this hotel is fresh and funky and feels like a W hotel but smaller and more special (with better music!). the staff is friendly and knowledgeable about the city and the location is really nice - a 15 minute tram ride (or 30 minute walk) gets you anywhere in the city. the street the hotel is on has a park in the middle, and is within a 5 minute walk to all sorts of shops and cafes. both rooms that i stayed in had a balcony overlooking a beautiful garden. and in the morning, a fabulous breakfast! i cannot recommend this hotel enough!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: acrobat7770
Reviews.Content: Everything from the booking, help with restaurants and the place were amazing. Stayed for a friends 30th birthday (16 of us) and the hotel staff helped even with ordering the birthday cake. Rooms were perfectly and tastefully decorated. Breakfast was fab - especially the tea (fine touches to the little things in life). Taxi's were ordered whenever required and drinks very reasonably priced. Would recommend this hotel to anyone and will definitely visit again. 10 out of 10.

Reviews.Title: “Very smart boutique hotel with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: ericblooms
Reviews.Content: we selected this hotel based on its description and price and were not disappointed in any way. we had only looked at a few online before selecting this and were pleased with our good fortune. it was easy to access and the staff - especially Jan at the Front Desk who was not only gorgeous, but sweet, attitude free, overly helpful and gave us detailed directions for our very brief stay in now one of my favorite cities - Amsterdam, which i cannot wait to visit again. highly recommended for those who want something stylish nice an accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, away from the stag parties”
Reviews.Author: imoore45
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in a great area - about 15 mins from the central train station by tram. We had a great room with balcony and didn't notice any excess noise from our neighbours. Good recommendations from front desk staff - excellent bars and restaurants easily within walking distance from the hotel. Breakfast also very enjoyable. Best to get down early though. Very good experience. Great for a romantic getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Really funky little hotel”
Reviews.Author: sparklymonkeys
Reviews.Content: Was pleasantly surprised by Hotel V. Has a lovely ambience and is very very funky, lots of purple and silver with wooden floors. It was in an ideal location as we were going to a gig at the arena but also wanted to be able to get to the centre easily and the excellent tram system makes this easy (it's well worth buying a ticket for a few days, we paid 13.50 eur for 72 hours and you can use these on all trams, metros and trains). Hotel is in walking distance of the de pijp district which is full of cool little bars and restaurants. It's far more 'Dutch' over this side of the city which means you can avoid groups of leery stag parties looking for the red light district. Also close by is Sarphati park which is gorgeous and you're also not too far from Vondlepark. The breakfast at the hotel was great and the breakfast room similarly excellent. The staff were wonderfully helpful and presented us with a map as soon as we got there and really helped us find our way around.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely week in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: kopalk
Reviews.Content: Lovely small hotel, slightly out of center but no problem becouse of excellent public transport - tram station just round the corner. Hotel suprisingly modern (Ikea style furniture) but most unusual is for sure the breakfast room. Breakfast suprisingly rich for a budget hotel. Excellent service!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel V â€¦ Wow, what a terrific experience!”
Reviews.Author: FloridaCoupleTKO
Reviews.Content: â€œHotel V â€¦ Wow, what a terrific experience! Warm and friendly staff, tastefully decorated yet comfortable rooms, and personalized service; these are the hallmarks of a fine lodging establishment. Hotel V has all this â€¦ and more. Its convenient location and scrumptious breakfast made our stay in Amsterdam a memorable one. But most of all, we will remember all of the warm, smiling faces of the people who took care of us at Hotel V. Overall, a 5-out-of-5 rating for us on Hotel V!â€�

Reviews.Title: “Extremely disappointing”
Reviews.Author: foppan21
Reviews.Content: This hotel looked fancy on their web site. Therefore I was extremely disappointed when I checked in to a room sized 1,5 x 2,5 meters, and a bed that only would be suitable for very small persons. My guess is that the bed was about 0,5 x 1,60 meters. The shower constantly fell off the wall, as did other items in the bathroom. The room was not cleaned during my two nights stay. The noise from other rooms and common areas was terrible, and there were no decent curtains, only some see through stuff which let all light in. After two nights I moved to the Radisson SAS, and slept a whole day to recharge.

Reviews.Title: “Five reasons not to stay here”
Reviews.Author: Thorsk
Reviews.Content: You should not stay at the Hotel V, because: 1. The rooms are tiny and the beds terrible. Okay, I stayed at a single room, and some of the others might be bigger. But this room was so small they could bearly fit a single bed in there. And tthe bed was so small that my feet were dangling outside (I'm 1.87). The bed was hard, uneven and I only got one tiny pillow. 2. I left my room at 10 am and came back at 3 pm to get some rest. The room had not been cleaned. An hour later, when I was having a nap, housekeeping knocked on my door, and gave me an ultimatum: Either I let them in now, or my room wouldn't be cleaned. 3. This hotel is quite a long way from where the action takes place in Amsterdam.You can't walk to the centre. 4. The breakfast is a joke compared to a full breakast. 5. The walls in the hotel ared paper thin. We stayed at the hotel for two horrible nights, and then moved to the Radisson SAS downtown Amsterdam. The price was twice as high, but it was worth every euro spent.

Reviews.Title: “Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: insertsoundhere
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel V for the second time last October, in celebration of my thirtieth birthday. Just like my first stay there, on my first visit to Amsterdam, I found the staff to be friendly, knowledgeable and happy to help. My room was clean, simple, and aesthetically pleasing. The hotel is located in a nice neighborhood, and there is easy access to the Centraal Station via tram. If you're a design fanatic (like me!) there is a great lamp shop just down the street, and the hotel itself was designed for the aesthetically indulgent. Simple, clean lines, and bold colors - not to mention the staircase - great for the calves! I humbly and wholeheartedly recommend the Hotel V for anyone looking for minimalist comfort and maximum relaxation during their holiday in Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Regular hotel V Spain Marta”
Reviews.Author: martola2002
Reviews.Content: Hello! We were in this hotel last weekend, the hotel is very expensive in my opinion are 330â‚¬, when is a hotel outside of center look very modern in the web, but really no is a hotel complety, i think you can booking other hotels in the center to same money. The breakfast is good but very simple There wasnÂ´t elevator.. We were in de second floor.... but is horrible.... If you go to a this hotel you try find other hotel best.

Reviews.Title: “city chic outside the centre of own”
Reviews.Author: Agent006
Reviews.Content: ignore the bad write ups. 10 minute tram tide on one of two lines and you are near everything you could want. Better still - walk! clean ikea style rooms, big, smart, warm and an interesting mix of guests. bravo

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous wedding night”
Reviews.Author: little_china_girl
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel to spend our wedding night. Is was the perfect atmosphere: hip, designy, small & cosy, personal and modern. As the staff knew it was our wedding night they tranformed the room into a romantic place. But although we had a special treatment, the design of the room was great. Smart solution for the small space they have, and roomy enough. Bathroom was designy too, no standard tiles or sinks. We were the latest guests for breakfast but the lounge style breakfast room was full of nice design details. Smart solution again for the buffet on shelves instead of the standard tabels. We just took a quick view in the lounge which looked comfortable, with internet access. The friendly staff made it perfect. And last but not least very affordable rates.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Marmund
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel V for one night. I really liked the hotel. It was small,quaint . The decor was cute(very Ikea). There was no elevator, which is common in small European hotels. Some reviews said the location was inconvienient. I found it very accessible by the #4 tram(10-15 mins) to the centre. I liked that it wasn't in a tourist area. The rooms are small but nicley decorated and I think great for the price. I found the staff really helpful with recommendations and directions. I would most certainly stay here again when in Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel I ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Nazim
Reviews.Content: We stayed at hotel V this week-end and it was a truly terrifying experience! First, when we got to Amsterdam quite early on Saturday, it took us almost 40 minutes to get to the suburb where the hotel is located and actually find the property. Walking to the hotel, we were shaken by the rows of century-old council houses, done up in bad taste, only to find out that our 4 star Design Hotel, was one of them. When we got there, we were told to come back later as check-in time was 2:00 PM and we couldn't stay in the area, because everything was so lacklustre, lugubrious, and felt unsafe. Then when we returned in the afternoon, we had to bring our bags up the 2 floors through a cramped and shappy staircase. The room, when we finally got to it, gave us shivers. The 1970s decor, the open shower, the cold and the noise from non-existant insulation. As a grand finale, the view from the (shared) balcony was ironically pittyful rather than pituresque. Simply traumatising landscapes! Finally, to top it all, we were literally thrown out of the room at 11AM by room service, after a tasteless breakfast, and the lady at the reception when we checked out (probably a senior manager) was despicable: a disgrace, in one word. In a nutshell, there is nothing to make up for any of the numerous drawbacks of this hotel. It's a sacrilege to recommend this hotel as a Design Hotel, in Amsterdam, close to everything. I am terribly dissapointed by this (costly) experience.

Reviews.Title: “SImple yet perfect”
Reviews.Author: AllanBonobo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights last week (2nd-4th October). After wandering around like a fool for half an hour in the wrong direction eventually found the hotel. Please note this was my fault. If i could read a map i'd be fine. The hotel is very welcoming and relaxed which makes check-in very easy. Staff were friendly without being overly-friendly or overly-cold. Up the steep stairs we found our room which was clean, neat and very well decorated. As with previous reports people may find the beds slightly soft but at least there are no springs drilling into your back. Breakfast was trypical Continental but it was of a good standard. The breakfast room was very nicely laid out and was "funky", if that's an appropriate word to use. The hotel is about 15 mintues away from the centre on the number 4 tram. We found this fine as it gets away from the hustle and bustle of the City centre. A cab back at night cost anything between 10 and 15 Euros. Fantastic hotel for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding -- great ambiance and superb customer service!”
Reviews.Author: prgrrl
Reviews.Content: An absolute gem of a botique hotel. So far our batting average with hotels has been 100% thanks to the web and good research. The Hotel V is a minimalistâ€™s dream -- from the classic Louis Poulsen artichoke chandelier hanging over our bed to the sleek, teak shelving in the bathroom to its terrazzo shower and floor. The staff was wonderful, oh so hip and helpfulâ€¦ and the breakfastsâ€¦ (The measure by which I generally judge a property)â€¦ were fantastic -- complete with my new favorite vacation toast topping (used to be just Nutella) now itâ€™s Nutella with hagelslag (chocolate sprinkles). Yeah, I know, seems a bit redundant, and oh so inappropriate for breakfast, but when on vacation, foods and their corresponding day part become irrelevant. Furthermore, Hotel V resides in a perfect neighborhood setting from which we set out each day for our adventures of discovery.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: joytex
Reviews.Content: It was quiet, confortable (good bed), and very central with the convenient trams 4,12, and 25. OK also for the breakfast and the kindness of the staff. I'll be back

Reviews.Title: “A stylish hotel for a perfect stay!”
Reviews.Author: FLIEGER67
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a one-night stay in Amsterdam, sunday to monday this week. I read some reviews here and yes, IÂ´am not disappointed at all. The staff was so friendly, the room small, but stylish and clean, the breakfast very good. The fastest way by public transport is the tram 4 to Rias station, it stops around the corner from the hotel at Vrijhejtslan, in a mainly residential area with no other hotels around. I feel safe all the time, also at night and I Â´am alone on travel. My room was on the top level, wooden floor, shower, booked for around 80.-- EUROS B&B, ok so far, by german consolidator Hotel--- No elevator as earlier announced, the stairs narrow but the staff was very helpful and asked if I need some help, but no problem for me. Around ten minutes by tram to the Dam, the city center. The chance for another stay at Hotel V is high!.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, great staff”
Reviews.Author: ValarieS
Reviews.Content: At first, I was disappointed with Hotel V because it seemed further away from central Amsterdam then I would have liked. But I came to see that as an asset - it was nice spending time in a real neighborhood rather than with tourists, and it was a 5 or 10 min train ride into Amsterdam proper, so it was still quite convenient. The staff was wonderful, though. On my 2nd to last night, I got food poisoning, and various members of the staff took turns entertaining my boyfriend (who didn't want to go too far because of my illness, but also didn't want to spend the whole of his last day in the city cooped up in a hotel room) and helping him locate things like chicken soup and juice for me. They also made up breakfast boxes for us when we had to leave early the next morning. They were very caring. The only undesirable thing about Hotel V was that there is no elevator, so you had to carry up all your luggage through as many as 4 flights of narrow stairs, but I'd stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Lovely staff. Modern, funky decor. Warming fire in lobby. Amazing breakfasts. A little out of the centre of town, but use the trams and you can get anywhere!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, stylish affordable hotel in a residential area of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: dandjaway
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed here in mid December 2005. We went to Amsterdam for a long weekend & decided to try something further from the centre, as whenever we did that (on our budget) it was always disappointing. We were pleasantly surprised by Hotel V. Although it was a tiny bit tricky to find at first after we stepped off the tram, a hint in our one recent guidebooks saying we wouldn't miss the purple front doors gave it away. The staff were very friendly & helpful. Although when we did ask with help to find somewhere to eat locally (meaning less than a 5 minute walk) the staff never seemed to know, each time he/she said they didn't know because they didn't live in the area... But we managed to find a great Mexican restaurant not too far away by ourselves for our 1st meal (we arrived late on a Friday night). I can't recall the street names anymore, but if you turn left out of the hotel & follow it to the main intersection/junction with the tram lines, turn LEFT (you'd be following that main road towards the city centre, not towards the congress/conference centre). Up a few blocks it's on the right-hand side of the street. Very tasty! Our room at Hotel V was fine. Our bed was great, large & comfy. But the shower/bathroom was a bit strange. The lighting was a bit too subdued & when in the shower one could hardly see. Also, there was a bit of mould growth on the walls in the shower. I think it was mainly because they had only painted the walls in the cubicle (no tiles). Or maybe perhaps they had forgotten to use the special kitchen/bathroom paint. But the amount of mould wasn't gross or anything, just a bit baffling. The soundproofness of the rooms could have been better. In a small hotel it's really important to have appropriate soundproofing both to other rooms & the street. It was not very good at Hotel V, so either travel with a group there so hopefully you'll know your neighbours or be aware it won't be quiet when others are awake or traipsing by your room. We stayed here because we wanted a nice, clean & economical hotel. It fit the bill on all of those areas so I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “unique, intimate and Dutch”
Reviews.Author: Pauli_NL
Reviews.Content: My stay was congress (physicians) related.I rented the entire hotel for my group. First visit of the hotel in April, congress in October 2005. Overall: hotel built in typical Dutch residential area&therefore a home transformed into a hotel.only two single rooms slightly too small for it to really enjoyable.all other rooms very bright and with the basic comfort needed.only don't expect a room to spend time in.the room is for your overnight rest and your shower. the rooms are well maintained and clean! Staff: Forecoming, friendly & experienced staff who clearly like what they're doing. They go out of their way to suite your wishes,Amsterdam is their city,Netherlands their country.That's reflected in how you're treated and how they inform you on questions you may have regarding possibilities in going out, dining, excursions. If you prefer surfing the web, a computer is at your free disposal in the "lobby" or the latest magazines on the Amsterdam scene are at the desk. Breakfast: as Dutch as breakfast can be,toast,various breads,eggs,various meats,cheese,sweets,muesli etc.Coffee,tea,OJ or other juices on request. The location is cute too.Don't expect luxury,it's kept simple but welcoming and with a view on unique design. The lobby: it's a transformed living room.a little fire is always on,candles add to the ambiance, a sofa invites to read your magazine should the weather prevent you from going out. Location: 10 minutes walk to congress center or 2 minutes by tram.Tram station just around the corner. Ideal for congress stays. To the city center it's approx a 15minutes tram ride, no change of lines necessary. Railway Station at congress center,from there a 10minutes ride to airport.(depending on train connection of course) Other: My guests were surprized at first.They expected a typical hotel.It's not.It's clearly a former home that became a hotel with a special touch of design. You may hear the shower of your neighbour,you may hear them coming back. But with a great city at your feet,with the tram station right within reach,with a staff that will not spare in effort to make your stay memorable,it's a place you might want to check out.

Reviews.Title: “Just as I imagined from the web page”
Reviews.Author: weeherdy
Reviews.Content: Hotel V's web page description is one of the most accurate I have ever seen. It was exactly as I had imagined and possibly even better (more atmosphere than its unlcuttered image might imply). Clean and bright, helpful, friendly staff and really stylish yet comfortable lounge and breakfast areas. Good buffet breakfast too (great Dutch bread rolls). My room on 4th floor (no lift and steep stairs) was clean, comfy and mercifully free of "hotel carpet"! Bathroom though small was just fine and shower had plenty of hot water, good pressure and was actually much more spacious than the size of the bathroom would imply. This hotel's location won't suit everyone as it is a good 10 min tram ride (stop just a couple of minutes away) from the centre, however for me it was great - quiet yet still very convenient for both city centre and airport/train. Not too much choice of good eating places in the immediate vicinity (big supermarket just round the corner!) so better to look for food more centrally. I would definitely stay there again - very good value and free internet access too!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable and Very European”
Reviews.Author: southernsibyll
Reviews.Content: We spent four very pleasant nights at the Hotel V. I was attending a conference near the RAI Conference Center and it was very convenient for my business purposes. However, overall the hotel is near lots of restaurants and a grocery store, which was super handy, and is walkable (a decent walk, but doable) to the Centrum and to the Van Gogh and Riljksmuseum. I recommend that you do as the Amsterdammers do and rent a bike or ride the SUPER WONDERFUL trams that go all over the city. The one that stops just yards away from the hotel goes straight downtown. While the rooms are not huge and my husband and I shared two twin beds pushed together, the hotel was otherwise charming, very clean and very...well, Dutch, which is exactly what we wanted. The beds had crisp white sheets with down comforters that made you want to sleep the day away. The bathrooms were spotless and included all the modern conveniences (e.g. hair dryer, great-smelling shampoos and body washes). Also, the water pressure was to die for. Breakfast was fantastic. Breads, cold cuts, jams, fruit, cereal. Anything you'd want short of a Denny's Grand Slam. There was free internet access in the lobby, which was great for checking in at home and making our traveling less worry-filled. The stairs are narrow and steep, but that's not unusal in European hotels. If you don't like stairs or are hauling some major luggage, just request a lower floor. The people at the desk were fantastic. We bugged them with dozens of questions about where to eat, what to see, etc., and they seemed thrilled to help us. To have that kind of warm reception more than made up for the inconvenience of the stairs. So, we'll definitely return, and I'm thrilled to have taken a chance on Hotel V, instead of reserving a room at the boring old Hyatt where my co-workers stayed.

Reviews.Title: “far from the action”
Reviews.Author: sirtravel
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel V with a friend and it was a good hotel, maybe slightly above average. Price OK (Euro 130/night) but here are the drawbacks... 1. No elevator and you have have to carry your luggage up some steep stairs (especially if you are on the third or fourth floors); 2. Simply an older Amsterdam apartment building that has been renovated; 3. Pretty far from the Center (but convenient if you are going to a convention at the RAI). If the price was under Euro 100 it would move my ratings up a bit. Probably will try someplace else the next time.

Reviews.Title: “a youth hostel - not a design hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We read about the Hotel in some style guides and the web site was nice so we book two double rooms for two couples for christmas shopping. The hotel is out of the center, it takes some stops with the tram. The owners invested some money and a lot of IKEA furniture to turn this small house in a "design hotel" - in truth it is more like a youth hostel with some nice style ideas. The room we stayed was the smallest double room i ever had and not very cosy. The bed was awful and the bathroom had the size of a towel. The price of 120 Euros was a joke. After seeing the room we did understand why you have to pay on check in.... The room of our friend was a bit bigger but not very much better. Quite nice and stylish are the public areas like the breakfast room and the small "lobby". I cannot recommend this hotel (regarding the price, location and their presentation as design hotel).

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Victorie
HotelInfo.Address: Victorieplein 42, Amsterdam 1078 PH, The Netherlands
